141.title: Tell Simba of her wish

choices: She finishes the whole thing
She can't finish it
1411.content:
As a male lion, Simba wasn't a very experienced hunter, so Nala had to take the lead as they stalked through the savannah looking for prey. After a while, they stumbled on a small herd of zebras resting in a clearing. Simba crouched down to spring out at the animals, but Nala held out her foreleg to stop him.

"We'll have a much better chance at taking one down if we go at them from two directions. I'm going to circle around. You wait here, and then pounce on my signal. Got it?" Simba nodded. He was excited for Nala to finally begin gaining, but he knew just enough about hunting to know that he would have to be patient.

After what felt like an hour, Simba saw a creamy paw rise above the tall grasses on the other side of the zebra herd. He sprang roaring into the clearing. The zebras panicked and ran off in all directions. The rush of zig-zagging black-and-white stripes around him made him dizzy. Whenever he tried to pounce on a particular animal, he found that it wasn't there any more. He had never really thought about a zebra's stripes being there to confuse lions, but now that he was in the middle of a rapidly-dispersing dazzle, he definitely understood that they weren't just for decoration.

To his shame, he didn't manage to catch a single zebra, and he had a bit of a headache when the animals dispersed. He was very disappointed until he saw that Nala had managed to take one down.

"Woah, how'd you do that?" he asked, flopping down next to her.

"Practice," she responded thickly. "Which is what you're going to have to do if we want this to work out." Nala was right, of course. Simba had no idea how to hunt, and if Nala had to catch her own food, she'd use up far too much energy to get really fat.

"I will, I promise," he reassured her. "But right now, we've got this nice zebra, so why don't you dig in, and let me worry about getting better at hunting."

"Oo-kay, but I don't want to have to be running around all the time..." Nala warned, then stood up and started chowing down on zebra.
1411.title: Zebra Tiiiime!

choices: Stay and digest
Bring it home
14112.content:
Without any further prompting, Nala dug in to the zebra she had killed. It was maybe a hundred pounds heavier than she was herself, which meant that it was an absolutely huge meal. Completely unused to eating more than a normal amount, she managed to put a good dent in the zebra, but didn't come anywhere close to finishing it. She wanted to eat more, but her stomach was already distended, and she felt like she would pop if she ate another bite.

"Uugh, I think I'm done," she said at last. Simba looked from her to the remaining zebra and then back again.

"Are you sure? There's a lot of food left," he prompted.

"Cut me some slack, I'm just starting out," she said with a moan. She didn't want him to be disappointed in her. He nuzzled up against her reassuringly.

"Don't worry, you did fine for a first-timer. Much better than I did hunting, anyway!" He chuckled, then continued. "We'll both get better with practice. At any rate, there's no use letting this zebra go to waste. Do you want to stay here until you can eat more, or should we drag it home?"
14112.title: A Slow Start

choices: Pretend that nothing's happening
Hide
141122.content:
"I think I can make it home," Nala replied. As she stood up, Simba noticed that her tummy was visibly rounded.

The two started for Pride Rock at a leisurely pace, in the hope that Nala would burn as few calories as possible. Simba was dragging the zebra along by himself for pretty much the same reason--plus, he felt like it was the least he could do after failing to kill any zebra himself. He couldn't keep his eyes of Nala's stomach. It was just a little thing, barely hanging below her otherwise slender frame, but it still excited him greatly. Real gain would take time, he knew, but after keeping his preferences a secret from his wife for so long, he was elated to see both of their desires starting to come to fruition.

As they neared Pride Rock, it suddenly hit Simba that someone was bound to see them going home, and if they were caught with most of a zebra, people would be sure to ask questions. He wasn't sure how committed Nala was to gaining weight, and the censure of the other lionesses might make her quit before she had even started. Nala was his queen, and he wanted to protect her and fulfill her desires.
141122.title: Zebra Takeout

choices: She just makes small talk
She asks them what they're doing
1411221.content:
He thought it might be better to circle around and try to sneak in the back way so there would be less chance of being seen, but as soon as he deviated from the most direct route back to their den, Nala noticed.

"Where are we going?" she asked skeptically.

"I didn't want the pride to see us coming home with a whole zebra. They might make us share, or worse, make fun of you."

Nala nuzzled her mate. "It's sweet of you to worry, but I think we can handle them. Just walk quickly and pretend like you're not doing anything unusual. I want to get home as quickly as possible so I can have some more of that zebra."

She didn't need to say anything else. Simba gladly headed straight for home, trying to find a balance between going quickly and looking nonchallant. Unfortunately, luck wasn't with the pair that day as far as stealth was concerned. They were within sight of their own den when they ran into Asha, another lioness.
1411221.title: Nothing to See Here...

choices: Nala wants to gain weight
Simba's trying to learn to hunt
14112212.content: "King Simba, Queen Nala," Asha greeted them as they passed. She was paler than Nala, with nearly white fur, and had always been just this side of uncomfortably slender. Simba held his breath, hoping that she wouldn't notice his cargo, but he had no such luck. She stared long and hard at the zebra, as if she couldn't quite believe it was real. Nala knew the source of Asha's confusion: The last time the lionesses had gone out hunting, they'd only caught gazelles, so there was no reason for Simba to be dragging a zebra. "What are you guys doing with that? Where'd you even find it?"
14112212.title: Suspicion

choices: Nala binges angrily
Nala's lost her appetite
141122121.content:
"I'm trying to gain weight," Nala answered defiantly before Simba could come up with a suitable lie. Asha's lips curled back in distaste.

"Why?" she asked incredulously. She was perfectly happy with her own slender frame: it made it easy to hunt and meant that she didn't have to spend a lot of time eating. The thought of someone trying to get fat on purpose was completely alien to her.

"I like to eat, and I'm the queen." Even to her own ears, Nala sounded a little defensive. It really wasn't any of Asha's business; Nala shouldn't have to explain herself like she was doing something wrong. "At any rate, I don't think I'll be coming on hunts any more."

Now, that made Asha mad. It was one thing for Nala to have some sick fantasy, but it was quite another to let said fantasy affect the rest of the pride. "You can't do that!" she exclaimed. "We need you to hunt, not lay around on your fat ass!" Nala went rigid.

"Lest you forget, Asha, I'm the queen," Nala said icily. "I can do whatever I want." And with that, she and Simba brushed past the pale lioness, who growled low in her throat.
141122121.title: The Truth Never Hurt Anyone

choices: Tell Nala what just happened
Keep her angry, keep her eating
1411221211.content:
"I can't believe the nerve of her!" Nala complained in between bites of zebra. "Who does she think she is that she can make judgements about my personal life!?"

Simba made a vague noise of agreement. The two lions had made it back to their den without any further interruptions, and as soon as they stepped inside, Nala tore into the remaining zebra with renewed vigor. Simba agreed with his mate: Asha had been totally out of line. But it was hard for him to focus on the other lioness when Nala was gorging herself right in front of him.

Angry and distracted as she was, she didn't seem to notice how much she was eating. She'd already gone past the amount of zebra she'd managed to stuff down earlier, and she didn't appear to be slowing down. So Simba just kept nodding and smiling while he watched her scarf down more and more of the big carcass, imagining every pound of food his mate consumed converted to beautiful jiggling fat. He would have been happy if Nala had simply eaten as much as she had before: two big meals a day was a lot for a lioness. But she was outstripping his every fantasy, and barely even realizing that she was doing it. He was overcome by love and admiration.

When about a quarter of the zebra remained, Nala abruptly stopped eating and growled. "If I eat another bite, I'm going to throw up," she announced.

Simba could have left it at that, but after seeing her eat just now, he was convinced that she could do better. "Do you think Asha will try anything?" he asked innocently.

"Oh, she had best not," Nala said, and, to Simba's delight, ripped another chunk of meat off the zebra and wolfed it down. Then she was off again, ranting about the pale lioness and eating until the rest of the zebra was gone.
1411221211.title: Angry Binge

choices: No, let's take it slowly
Sure, I can deal with this
14112212111.content:
"Ohhh..." Nala groaned when she'd finally calmed down. "I feel like I'm going to explode..."

"Of course you do," Simba replied, elated. "You ate that whole zebra!" For a moment, Nala looked at him like he'd gone crazy, but he just kept smiling at her, and eventually, she surveyed the damage and found that he was telling the truth. No wonder she felt like she was about to pop! That zebra must have weighed five hundred pounds, and aside from the sixty or so pounds she'd managed to eat the first time around, that was all inside of her now.

She flopped down onto her side; her stomach was huge! It looked like she'd swallowed a boulder. Simba padded up to it and lay against it. His purring was soothing, but now that her anger had faded, being this overfull hurt! Nala moaned in pain.

"You ate a lot more when you were distracted," Simba mused. Well, yeah, that was obvious, but Simba wasn't done. "If we could find a way to get you worked up every time you ate, I bet you'd be able to gain a lot quicker."

Nala wasn't sure that that was a good idea. She wanted to get fat, but this wasn't a good feeling, and besides, all that anger had left her emotionally drained and exhausted. She felt so miserable that if gaining weight hadn't been her lifelong dream, she would have told Simba to forget the whole thing.
14112212111.title: A Way that Works

choices: Simba agrees
Simba resolves to force-feed her
141122121111.content: "I can't, Simba," Nala replied. He stood up again so that they could actually see each other's faces. "I'm sorry, but I feel horrible. If it was like this all the time, I think I'd hate gaining." She saw his disappointed look and added softly, "Hey, don't be sad. Someday, I'll be able to eat a whole zebra and more. It'll just take a little while, and I want us both to enjoy getting there."
141122121111.title: Take It Easy

choices: The next day, Nala teaches Simba to hunt
Simba and Nala's dreams
1411221211111.content:
"Of course, love," Simba agreed, laying back down against her engorged stomach. "I'm sorry I got so carried away. It's just that you're so beautiful when you're like this..."

"You don't have to be sorry," Nala replied. "I mean, I want to get this big some day. Bigger, even. I want to be so hugely fat that I can't even walk! I never want to have to stop eating...but getting to that point will take time, and eating until I'm miserable won't get me there any faster. Well, I mean, maybe it will, but I want to enjoy getting fat."

"I know. I want you to enjoy getting fat, too. But for now, let's just get some sleep. It's been quite a day, and everything will be better tomorrow. I love you, Nala."

"I love you, too." She snuggled up closer to him, so that her overstuffed belly was pressed right up against him. They dozed off like that, cuddled together.
1411221211111.title: Simba Agrees

choices: Simba eventually catches something
Simba is hopeless
14112212111111.content:
The next day, Nala's stomach was still distended, though less painfully so. Moving with a heavy, hanging stomach felt weird, but she didn't have time to dwell on it for better or worse: Simba needed to learn how to hunt, and quickly, if she was going to be able to devote herself to gaining any time soon.

The two lions set out for some practice, and Nala quickly found, to her dismay, that even with her bloated belly throwing off her center of gravity, she was still a much better hunter than Simba. He was too eager to jump at prospective prey, and apparently failed to realize that most of the animals they hunted could easily outrun them over long distances. Nala understood that her mate didn't have the lifetime of practice she and the other lionesses did, but it was still frustrating for her that he was such a clumsy hunter.

She herself managed to take down a gazelle, so she didn't go hungry that day, but Simba, for all his energy and effort, was no help.
14112212111111.title: Hunting Lessons

choices: Finish the hartebeest
They get called back to Pride Rock
141122121111111.content:
Simba had no idea what he was doing, but he was strong and smart and agile. Even so, it was several weeks before he was able to catch anything himself. During that time, Nala was sporadically able to kill something, and, as they were still part of the pride, it wasn't like she went hungry even when she wasn't able to catch anything. But it did mean that she wasn't able to gain more than a few pounds over the couple months that she was teaching Simba.

Finally, though, when she was crouching in the grass one day, watching a herd of hartebeests, the animals all scattered suddenly, before Nala had moved a muscle. A bit huffily, she padded over to where she knew Simba had been hiding, to chew him out for startling the hartebeests. but to her surprise, he was standing over a carcass, his paws and muzzle bloodied. Nala's mood lightened immediately, and she took the rest of the distance between them in a single excited leap, nuzzling up against her mate regardless of what a mess he was.

"You did it, Simba!" she exclaimed. "Good job!" In fact, it hadn't been a very good job, as evidence by the amount of wasted blood spattered everywhere, but the last thing Nala wanted to do was discourage Simba from hunting now that he'd finally had a success.

"Well," he said with a grin, "I think you know how you can thank me." Nala laughed, nuzzled him again, and then got to eating.

It was a relatively small hartebeest, which was to be expected, as the little ones were easier to kill. Nala managed to finish about a third of it before she had to give up--not a huge amount of food, but certainly more than the average lioness could eat. Once she was sure she couldn't stuff down another bite, she flopped down on her side. Simba cuddled up to her bloated stomach, which was hard beneath her soft fur.

This had become something of a routine between the two of them. Ever since running into Asha that first time, Simba and Nala had found it less of a hassle to just stay out until Nala managed to finish whatever it was she caught. Today, though, the dynamic was different: Simba had finally been able to feed his queen all by himself! He rubbed affectionately against her gut, and she purred at him in response.
141122121111111.title: First Success

choices: He returns with more food
She goes looking for him
1411221211111111.content:
Throughout the rest of the day, Nala munched on the hartebeest whenever she felt up to it, but it still wasn't gone quite gone by the time night fell. She and Simba were no strangers to spending the night on the savannah on their little hunting trips, so they curled up together and went to sleep.

The next morning, Nala awoke feeling refreshed, excited, and hungry. Having digested the previous day's meals, she scarfed down the remaining meat without any trouble. Only once she finished her breakfast did she realize that Simba was nowhere to be found.
1411221211111111.title: The Next Morning

choices: Go home
Stay out
14112212111111111.content:
Nala lifted herself to her feet. There hadn't been much of the hartebeest left, so her stomach wasn't visibly distended, nor had she gained noticeable weight. She was a bit disappointed at that, but she knew that, realistically, weight gain took time, especially after a lifetime of activity. She sniffed the air, hoping to catch a whiff of her mate.

She could definitely smell him, plus something else. After a moment, he padded into her line of sight, dragging the body of another hartebeest behind him. When he got close to her, he dropped the carcass.

"Morning, darling!" he said brightly. "I got up early and found that herd from yesterday again. Hope you're hungry!"

"Wow, Simba, thanks!" Nala said, and then she dug in. Perhaps this hartebeest was smaller than the last one had been, but she felt like she was eating more, and, indeed, there was less of the animal left when she finished her meal. Since she'd also gotten an earlier start, she finished the rest of it with no trouble before the sun had even begun to set.

She heaved herself to her feet, and unlike that morning, it was a bit of a chore. Her stomach hung down heavily between her legs, which made walking a bit awkward; plus, her tummy complained whenever she started to move too fast.
14112212111111111.title: Another Day, Another Meal

choices: Simba's presence is urgently required
Nala is having mobility problems
141122121111111112.content:
Seeing the trouble she was having, Simba rounded on Nala. "Easy there, darling! I don't want you overtaxing yourself. Lay back down; we can head back when you're a little less bloated." Nala complied, but her conscience was nagging at her.

"Shouldn't we be getting back, though? We've never been gone this long, and the rest of the pride will worry..."

"The rest of the pride will be fine," Simba reassured her. "There's nothing going on that requires my attention, and I trust everyone to manage their own day-to-day affairs themselves. Now, just rest here. I'm going to go try and find you a little more food."

Nala wanted to protest that that would be counterproductive to actually, y'know, getting back to Pride Rock eventually, but she thought better of it. After all, she wanted to get fat, and she definitely liked the idea of just laying around and waiting for her husband to bring her more food. So she silently watched him dash away.

By the time he got back, dragging a zebra behind him, she was hungry again. She ate until her stomach was painfully distended, and even then she continued to nibble at the carcass until it was time to go to sleep again.

When she finished the zebra, late the next day, Simba once again decided that she should rest until she'd digested, and once again went out hunting while she rested. She was once again hungry by the time he returned with more food, and once again ate herself into a state where getting home would be unpleasant.

The two of them continued like this for many days. Simba, whose hunting quickly got better with practice, started bring back larger animals, and the increased availability of food, coupled with her almost total lack of movement, meant that Nala was finally starting to pack on the pounds. Her legs thickened, and she quickly developed a second chin. Where she experienced the most growth, though, was in her stomach, which hung down almost to her knees on the rare occasions she bothered to stand. After the first few days, she stopped making any effort to head home, much preferring to lay around and let her mate pamper her. As a result, the muscles in her legs atrophied, making moving even more of a chore, which in turn made her even more inclined to just stay in one place and stuff herself.

With Simba fast becoming a good enough hunter to support his queen's hunger indefinitely, the two lions were content to stay out in the wilds, but they eventually had to return to the pride because...
141122121111111112.title: A Vicious Cycle

choices: The journey back
When they arrive
1411221211111111122.content:
While both of them were happy that Nala was gaining so well, they knew deep down that they'd have to return to the pride sooner or later. And at Nala's current weight, it looked like it had to be sooner. More time had passed, and Nala had continued to eat ravenously and near-constantly, stopping only when she couldn't eat another bite--and that point was retreating farther back every day. Her stomach was large enough now to brush the ground when she stood, and it pushed her thick legs outward, giving her a prounounced waddle.

One day, while she was in the middle of devouring a cape buffalo, she decided that she had to broach the subject. She and Simba had been seeing less of each other during the days, as he had to spend more time than he liked hunting to keep her totally stuffed. Now, though, he was sitting by her watching her eat, obviously as happy at her progress as she was. It was the best opportunity she was likely to get.

"Simba?"

"Yes, my love?"

"I think we should go back to Pride Rock soon," she said between huge bites. "I'm serious."

"Why? We have everything we need right here." He was right, of course, but this wasn't just about the two of them.

"You're the king, Simba. The pride needs you, and it's not fair to them if we spend the rest of our lives out here. And if we don't leave soon, I won't be able to go at all. I want to be immobile someday, darling, but I'd rather do it at home."

Simba sighed. "You're right. I don't want this--" he waved a paw at their surroundings "--to end, but you're right. We'll leave in the morning." He smiled. "Now, eat up. You'll need your strength for the trip tomorrow."
1411221211111111122.title: Mobility Problems

choices: "In fact, we don't need you at all."
"Not that that gives you the right to just leave."
14112212111111111222.content:
It took the couple quite a while to make their way back home. For one thing, they had ventured to the very edges of the Pride Lands in an effort to avoid seeing anyone they knew, and for another, Nala just moved more slowly these days. Simba had a hard time staying behind his queen as she made her ponderous way back to Pride Rock, but it was worth it for the view. Nala really had fattened up over the past few weeks, and Simba was determined to let her keep gaining once they got home.

When they finally arrived, the first lion they ran into, unfortunately, was Asha. She looked Nala up and down, her lips curled into such a sneer that Simba half-suspected that she was related to Scar. "Oh, I should have known you were out feeding the hippopotamus," she said icily. Simba wasn't about to dignify that with a response, and besides, the thought of Nala being the size of a hippo was hardly a bad image. He grinned despite himself.

"Have you and the lionesses had any trouble while we've been gone?"

Asha shook her head, still eying Nala, who stared back defiantly. "No, sire," she said, her voice dripping with false servility. "It's been pretty quiet here since you ran off. Again." That one did hurt a little, though he knew intellectually that he wasn't really culpable for running away after Mufasa's death all those years ago. She continued...
14112212111111111222.title: Back at Pride Rock

choices: I'm abdicating
I'm putting you in charge of feeding Nala
141122121111111112222.content:
"Not that that gives you the right to just leave. You're the king, whether you--or I--like it or not, and that means you have duties that you need to attend to. You can't ignore the needs of the pride to focus on your lardass wife."

Simba thought that over for a moment. Eventually, he said, "You're right, Asha," and both lionesses gasped. "That's why..."
141122121111111112222.title: A Dressing-Down

choices: Yes
No
1411221211111111122222.content:
"I'm putting you in charge of feeding Nala."

"What!?" Asha exclaimed, but then her lips curled into a smirk. "Actually, that might not be too bad. I could have her back in shape in no time."

"I don't think you understand me, Asha," Simba said gravely. "You won't get to decide what she eats; your job will simply be bringing her food when she desires it."

"And if I say no?" Asha challenged.

"The pride has many good hunters. We don't need you." Asha continued to glare daggers at Simba even after that threat, but she eventually lowered her gaze.

"Fine," she said.

"And Nala? Is this all right with you, my love?"

"Oh, definitely," the fat lioness replied with a smile.

"Wonderful! And be sure to tell me if Asha tries anything. I'll see you back at the den later." And with that, he turned around and walked away, leaving the two lionesses alone.

It took much longer than Asha was comfortable with to get back to Simba and Nala's den. Nala was fat enough that she moved at a slow, shuffling waddle, and Asha kept accidentally getting too far ahead and having to circle back, lest Nala tell her husband that Asha had abandoned her. When they finally reached their destination, Nala collapsed in a fat heap, obviously exhausted from the short walk. Asha was disgusted.

"Asha, can you go get me a zebra or something? I haven't had anything to eat all day."

The pale lioness growled low in her throat, hating to ordered around by something like Nala, but she complied, and soon came back with a zebra carcass.

Nala thanked her (in what Asha heard as a very sarcastic voice), and then started in on the zebra. Intellectually, Asha had known that Nala must have been eating more than a normal lioness to get so fat, but this was insane! The queen devoured the zebra like she hadn't eaten in weeks, her already-sizable sides expanding outwards as she ate. Once there was nothing left of the zebra but bones, Nala laid back contentedly on her big stomach.

"Um," she said, sounding a bit embarrassed. "I'm still a little hungry. Could you go get me something else?"
1411221211111111122222.title: Asha's New Duties

choices: Nala asks Asha to help feed her
Nala surprisingly eat all ten hippos
14112212111111111222221.content:
"Yes, Nala, I'll go get you some more food." Asha said after a length of silence.
If Nala wanted to eat and get fatter, then that's what Asha will do. She'll test to see how much food she could actually eat, even force-feed that fat lioness hippo if she had to, which Asha might get a kick out of. She had to do this covertly though without Simba knowing or Nala telling Simba what she was doing. Maybe even if she made Nala so fat and huge that she'd get ugly fat, Simba would be in love with Asha instead and the shame Nala would live with would be far greater than what Asha had suffered so far. So out she went, out of the den and down the trail. Asha headed towards the waterhole with ten other lionesses to help her. She knew that they'd have to move Nala out of the den soon and outside at the discussion area where the pride had its gathering talks or the fat lioness hippo would fill up the den and end up destroying pride rock from the inside out. At least outside, Nala wouldn't do any harm to their pride rock.

When Asha and the other ten lionesses returned, it was in the evening time. Several paw lengths before dusk. Arriving into the den, Asha came to Nala. "I brought you food, Nala, but you'll have to be moved outside first to eat it." With that, the other ten lionesses entered and helped Nala to stand up. Asha gasped at how much fatter was was, cause her belly firmly pressed on the floor of the den. Her legs were now three times thicker with rolls that cascaded all the way down her legs to almost cover up her paws. Her sides were wider with big bulges on both sides of her body torso. Her neck rolls were so much now at a number of ten thick rolls that even hung down to the ground between her wide-spread fat paws and in front of her chest fat. Her back fat was bulged up above her fat shoulders and over the level of her fat head in several wobbly bulges that move like ocean waves. Her tail was so thick with big fat rolls that she could hardly move it and her rump was so bulging with flab that it billowed out behind her a few feet, it was also wide out to the sides at four feet from hip to hip with her fat tail resting down between and on top of her rump. Her face cheeks were now like twin large beachballs on both sides of her head. Asha thought she must have digested the rest of the food she had eaten while she was away. Ignoring this, the other lionesses helped Nala make her way outside.

"Ten big hippos?" Nala exclaimed, surpised by the amount of food brought to her.
"Yes. And they are all for you. So eat up." Asha said, but watching Nala who settled down onto her large belly, likely her body weighed in a total of half a ton but it was hard for Asha to guage Nala's weight.
"Oh, thank you, thank you." Nala happily said and begun to feast on the closest fat hippo.
Asha, sat down to watch, she had made sure to get only the biggest of hippos. Making sure each one weighed at or near four tons each. Asha motioned for the other lionesses to go get more which Nala didn't see, the fat lioness was too busy stuffing and gluttoning herself. She hoped her plan for revenge on Nala would succeed.
14112212111111111222221.title: Asha tests Nala's hunger

choices: Banishment
To be fattened up alongside Nala
14112212111111111222222.content:
"I think you've had enough for one day." It took the bloated queen a moment to register what Asha said, but she struggled to her feet and stared down the pale lioness, teeth bared slightly.

"Excuse me?" Nala growled. "I'm sorry, I know that sounded like a request, but it was a command. Fetch me more food."

"N-no," Asha said, holding her ground. "I refuse to help you fatten yourself up like a hippopotamus. It's disgusting, it's unhealthy, and I want no part of it." Nala stared her down, but she held the queen's gaze. This was something she felt incredibly strongly about, and she wasn't going to back down, consequences be damned.

Nala broke eye contact first: a young lioness was passing by the den, and Nala asked her to go fetch Simba. The lioness, who hadn't been keeping up with the pride gossip, stared at Nala's hanging belly for a moment and then, assuming that the queen was pregnant, hurried away.

It wasn't long before Simba returned. Asha had thought about fleeing before he got back--it wasn't as though Nala would have been able to catch her--but had stayed put. She was no coward. This was her fight, and she was going to see it through to the end.

"What seems to be the trouble, darling?" he asked his made, who had relaxed back into a reclining position.

"I'm not going to help you kill your wife," Asha declared before Nala could say anything. Simba stared at her with wide-eyed surprise, but his eyes quickly narrowed.

"I don't remember that being your choice to make, Asha," he growled.

"I don't care!" she shot back. "You can kill me if you want to, but I'm not gonna be party to you lunatics any longer."

"Very well," Simba said gravely. "As much as your actions merit it, we don't kill here. But I told you we didn't need your hunting skills, and I meant it. Your punishment will be..."
14112212111111111222222.title: Defiance

choices: Get Nala to eat her food
Eat what she was given, but excercise the calories away
141122121111111112222222.content:
"...to be fattened up alongside Nala." Asha gasped sharply.

"You can't mean that!"

"Of course I can, Asha. You've shown unacceptable disdain toward your queen, and I think it's about time that you were humbled a little." Asha collapsed to the ground from shock. She put her forepaws over her eyes as if she was willing this to be a bad dream.

"Cheer up," Nala said with a smirk. "It's not so bad. I think you'll enjoy gaining weight." When that elicited a pained moan from Asha, Nala smiled. Maybe she was being a little mean, but Asha had been much meaner. Nala was going to enjoy watching her lose her precious figure.

Simba installed guards outside the den to make sure Asha wouldn't try to run, and within short order, he'd assigned a trio of new feeders, three lionesses who were barely full-grown and who didn't share Asha's opinion of weight gain. While two of the feeders busied themselves with Nala, the third dropped a large chunk of meat in front of Asha, who eyed it dubiously.

"Eat up," the feeder said cheerfully. When Asha made no move toward the meat, she added, "If you don't eat by yourself, I've been ordered to force you" in the same chipper tone.

Asha considered her options, and decided that anything was better than having this simpering little lioness stuff food down her throat. "I can eat by myself, thanks," she snapped. "Leave me alone." To her great surprise, the feeder complied, walking out of the den to give her some privacy (well, as much privacy as she could have with a fatass like Nala chowing down beside her).

"I'm going to check back on you in a little bit!" Asha's feeder called from the mouth of the den. "I expect you to finish what you have by then!"

There was no way Asha was just going to sit back and let herself become a disgusting blob, no matter what anyone thought. She thought about how to avoid gaining weight and decided that the best plan would be to...
141122121111111112222222.title: The Weight of Punishment

choices: Asha has gained some weight
Asha's still the same size, which makes people suspicious
1411221211111111122222222.content:
Slowly, Asha started on her meal, trying to figure out exactly how much exercise she'd have to do in order to prevent herself from gaining weight. The problem was that the den she was in wasn't that big, and she couldn't run for any reasonable distance without her feeder at the entrance noticing. So she had to settle for exercises that could be done more-or-less in place. She was confident that she could keep her figure just doing those, but it would take a heck of a lot longer. She worked out for a bit between each bite of meat, trying to work off the big meal before it had time to do anything to her body.

Nala, for her part, didn't notice any of this. She ate much faster than Asha did, true, but she also had significantly more food: Asha had been given only slightly more than an average meal to start off with, but Nala, a practiced overeater, had been given a whole eland, and it was keeping her pretty busy. As much as she was eager to see Asha start to fill out, she knew from personal experience that weight gain took time, and anyhow, the eland was really delicious.

It was also a bit more than she was used to eating, but that was fine by her. Now that she had a couple lionesses on full-time feeding duty, she was eager to really start fattening herself up. In some ways, it was too bad that Asha couldn't have stayed her feeder--it would serve the pale lioness right to have to help Nala gain weight--but, all things considered, things were pretty good. Asha was being punished and Nala had helpful, attentive feeders.

Her stomach filled up before she could finish the eland, though. She rolled laboriously over onto her side to relieve some of the pressure on her gut, but she was stuffed tight. Nonetheless, she continued to nibble lightly at the remaining meat, even as her stomach groaned ominously from fullness.

As it turned out, Nala had such a large amount of meat that Asha finished before she did, much to her chagrin. The pale lioness looked, Nala felt, altogether a bit too pleased at that, but she chalked it up to general vindictiveness. At least at this rate, Asha would be huge soon.

Two weeks later...
1411221211111111122222222.title: Contrasting Diets

choices: Nala
One of the guards
14112212111111111222222221.content:
Despite her best efforts, Asha hadn't been able to completely avoid gaining weight. It seemed that in-place exercise just wasn't a match for all the food she was being forced to eat, and her once-flat belly was starting to pooch out a little, though since she'd been working out consistently, her muscles elsewhere hadn't lost any definition. Although she'd only gained a few pounds, Asha felt awfully heavy and hated it. How could anyone think that this was a good idea?

What she was doing to keep herself from getting fat clearly wasn't cutting it, so Asha decided that she had to take a more drastic step. That night, after the other lions had gone to bed, she crept out of the den--making a special effort not to disturb Nala's sleeping bulk. With her own little belly, she felt huge and unwieldy, but she nevertheless managed to sneak past the snoozing guards/feeders without waking them up. Once she was a little ways away, she broke into a run.

Damn, she had missed this. The cool night air streaming past her face, the crunch of dry grass under her paws, the breathless burn that came from pushing herself--it was all heavenly after spending the past two weeks cooped up in that stupid den. She blazed through the sleeping savannah for a long time until her run brought her, exhausted but happy, back to Pride Rock.

She took special care to quiet her heavy breathing as she snuck back inside. But as she was about to lay down and get some sleep, she heard movement and immediately went totally still, hyperconscious of her heart, which was still beating fast from her run. The noises didn't stop or move away, and eventually Asha saw that she had been caught by...
14112212111111111222222221.title: Night Running

choices: Fine, under one condition
Heck no! I'm telling!
141122121111111112222222211.content:
Asha realized that the reason it didn't look like anyone was moving in the dark den was because she was expecting to see someone her own size. When she adjusted her perception a little, she saw that Nala had risen to her feet.

That surprised her. She didn't think she'd seen the queen stand up the whole time she'd been trapped in here. Mostly all Nala did was lay on her front or her side and eat, and where Asha had only gained a couple pounds, Nala had porked out noticeably. Asha doubted that there was any space between the queen's gut and the floor, and her vague silhouette was noticeably rounder than a lion's outline should have been.

"Who's there?" the fat lioness hissed into the darkness, and then, after a moment, she added, "Asha?"

"Shh!" Asha replied, looking back worriedly at the mouth of the dens. Nala was one thing, but if the guards found out that she had snuck out, she'd definitely be punished, and she felt that she was already being punished enough, thanks.

"What are you doing up at this hour?" Nala sniffed the air. "And why are you all sweaty? Have you been outside!?"

"Shh! Nala, please don't tell anyone! I thought I was going to go crazy, stuck in this den all day with nothing to do! Just...just don't say anything to the feeders, okay? Please?"
141122121111111112222222211.title: Pleading

choices: Asha gives up
Asha tries to sneak out again
1411221211111111122222222111.content:
Asha sounded so scared and sad that Nala couldn't help but take a little bit of pity on her.

"Okay," she whispered, "But you have to do something for me."

"What?" Asha asked sharply. She knew a lot better than to blindly agree to whatever terms Nala deigned to put forth.

"Don't do this ever again," Nala said. "Just stay inside from now until your punishment ends." Asha considered this. It was definitely not her first choice, but when the alternative was to let Nala rat her out, it sounded pretty darn good. And exercising in place was at least sort of helpful for keeping weight off.

"Deal."

"Deal. Good night." And with that, Nala lowered herself back down (impressively quietly for a lioness of her size) and went back to sleep. After a last longing glance outside, Asha did the same.

The next morning, Nala made a point of watching Asha during breakfast. The pale lioness still ate reluctantly, and Nala noticed for the first time that the weird contortions Asha went through as she ate were supposed to be exercises. That explained why she had gained so little weight, at least so far. Nala smirked. It was only a matter of time until Asha really started to get fat. And with that happy thought, Nala turned her attention back to her own breakfast.
1411221211111111122222222111.title: A Bargain Is Struck

choices: She gets caught
She gets away with it
14112212111111111222222221112.content:
For more than a month, Asha kept her promise to Nala, fearful that the queen would turn her in. She ate everything she was given and exercised as much as she could manage without leaving the den. But despite her best efforts, she couldn't totally keep herself from gaining weight. The portions she was given grew over the weeks, and while she generally found she was able to manage them, they were wreaking havoc on her figure. Her belly hung midway down her thighs, which had thickened embarrassingly, to the point where she was sure that she'd developed a bit of a waddle.

Next to Nala, of course, she looked like she was starving. If Asha's portions had grown, Nala's had all but exploded, to the point where the queen spent most of her waking moments eating. Her stomach had become big enough that she could rest on it, and though her paws still touched the ground, they were pushed out by her huge gut. Asha doubted that she could walk any more, though there was no way to tell for sure, because Nala never walked in any case. Walking burned calories, after all, and it took time away from eating--and those were two things that Nala certainly didn't want.

This evening, Nala's fat face was buried in a pile of miscellaneous carcasses. It wasn't exactly "dinner" as such, because the queen didn't much go in for distinct meals any longer. She just ate consistently, occasionally falling asleep if she got too full. Asha had long ago finished her own dinner, and was trying to work out, but she had never gotten the hang of ignoring Nala's binges, so her concentration was continually assaulted by the fat lioness' chewing and moaning. She clamped her forepaws over her ears to drown out the sounds of eating, but it wasn't much good.

Asha couldn't take it any more. She knew that if she didn't do something drastic, she would end up at Nala's size sooner or later, and that thought terrified her. So, heedless of the consequences, she snuck out again that night. It wasn't quite as magical as it had been last time: the night was colder, for one thing, but most of the problem was how much her stamina had deteriorated over the last few weeks. She found herself getting tired long before she should have, but she pushed past it, only returning to the den when she was completely exhausted.
14112212111111111222222221112.title: Can't Take It

choices: Asha keeps sneaking out and eventually starts losing weight
Asha decides to run away for good
141122121111111112222222211122.content:
When she got back to the den, Asha did her best to stifle the heavy breathing that was the result of her long run. The supposed guards were, as always, snoozing in front of the den, and she passed them with no trouble. However, remembering what had happened last time and dreading the consequences if she was caught again, Asha crept into the den inch by slow, agonizing inch, freezing at the slightest noise. She took great care to avoid Nala's sleeping bulk as much as possible. The fat queen had become a heavier sleeper as she became a heavier lioness, but she had been the one to catch Asha last time, so the pale lioness knew to be careful.

Finally, after taking so long that she was sure the sun would rise and catch her in the act, she laid down as quietly as possible in a corner of the den. Exhausted from her jaunt, she fell asleep almost instantly.

When she awoke the next morning, the sun was high in the sky and her breakfast was piled in front of her.

"Morning, sleepy head!" Nala said cheerfully when, out of the corner of her eye, she saw Asha getting up. It wasn't like the pale lioness to sleep late. Perhaps the confined, pampered life was finally getting to her. At the salutation, Asha froze up, and Nala smiled. Asha was probably embarrassed that Nala had gotten up before her.

"Leave me alone," she muttered, tucking in glumly to her breakfast. Nala wasn't usually one to not eat when there was food sitting in front of her (and there was always food sitting in front of her), but, petty though it may be, she enjoyed having a good chance to needle Asha.

"Aw, don't be like that," Nala replied in a too-sweet voice. "I didn't mean anything by it. You're right, lazing around is great." For emphasis, she stretched her obese body as much as she could. Of course, she didn't do anything but laze around.

Nala was pleased to see Asha scowl and tuck into her meager (from Nala's perspective) breakfast with renewed vigor, as though she was taking out her annoyance with Nala on the food. Good. If she kept eating like that, she'd be too fat to even think about exercising soon.
141122121111111112222222211122.title: Sneak

choices: Asha gets caught
Asha makes it out of Pride Rock and away from the other lions
1411221211111111122222222111222.content:
Asha couldn't risk sneaking out every night. The occasional night runs she afforded herself kept her weight more or less down, thank goodness, but the pale lioness still felt stifled from having to stay in the cave all the rest of the time.

It certainly didn't help that the cave itself was becoming less comfortable. Nala had gone from fat to obese to immobile to...well, ridiculous. Her useless legs were covered in thick rolls, her neck had disappeared into a series of chins, and even her tail had gotten fat enough to crease when she moved it--one of the very few movements she was still capable of. But all of that was dwarfed by her enormous stomach, which lifted her several feet off the ground and spread out under her to the point where it infringed on Asha's side of the cave. Still hugely uncomfortable with the huge lioness, Asha slept as far away from her as possible, but the pale lioness couldn't help feeling that one day the queen would roll over and crush her under her bulk.

Eventually, Asha knew she had to either escape or go mad. She was so sick of watching other lionesses shove food into Nala's greedy maw (Nala, no longer able to move her head enough to get at food laying on the ground, now required constant assistance from her feeders) as though it was no big deal that she felt just about ready to savage a feeder. There was no help for it; she had to leave Pride Rock.

It was not a decision she made lightly. She'd been out on the savannah on hunts, of course, but she'd never heard of any lions surviving without a pride. But she didn't care: dying alone was a preferable fate to spending any more of her life trapped in a cave with Nala.

Asha planned her escape carefully, spending days learning the movement of the guards and feeders who came into the cave, figuring out just the right time to strike. During that time, she dutifully ate the food she was given and refrained from exercising as much as she could bear to. Let them think that she was giving in; it would only make it easier for her to get away if everyone thought she was defeated. During her planning period, she plumped out to a degree that she personally found disgusting, though not enough to impede her movement. There was just a little more hang to her belly, a little resistance when she looked down that indicated the start of a second chin. She could deal with such things if it meant finally escaping this torment.

Finally, the big night came. Asha waited until Nala was deeply asleep after one of the queen's innumerable binges, then timed her movements precisely to avoid the guards who stayed outside while she and Nala slept. Once the pale lioness was out of sight of the cave, her quest became both easier and more difficult: easier, because there were no dedicated guards on duty, but more difficult because she had only briefly surveyed the area during her night runs, and hadn't canvassed anyone's movements like she had the cave guards'.
1411221211111111122222222111222.title: Asha's Escape

choices: Next morning and Asha's stuffing begins
Nala and Asha's feeding after a week
14112212111111111222222221112221.content:
Just as the plump pale lioness made it out of Pride Rock's cave, a shadowy musculine figure loomed in front of her. Asha gasps sharply as Simba stepped into the moon light with a very displeased frown arcing across and down his muzzle, Simba's brows were furrowed angerily as well.

"So, Asha, you once again try to escape. Well, I'll not be gentle in punishing you. Now your going to help move Nala out of the cave and behind Pride Rock where I've been managing the build of a Kilamanjaro mountain sized shelter for Nala. Thanks to the monkeys, of course. Now back to the cave with you. I won't let you off easy this time."

Asha was shocked and with a grudging groan, she turned to waddle back into the cave to see the other feeder lionesses had
returned but not woken the sleeping fat blob form of Nala. Asha watched as the feeder lionesses all went to one of Nala's fat bloated sides and stood there, looking at her.

"Go help them, now." Said Simba quitely but still in a hushed anger at Asha.

Groaning more, Asha went over to help the feeder lionesses push at Nala to roll her out of the cave, then down Pride Rock's promotory incline, to back around and behind Pride Rock and inside the new monkey built shelter but the pushing and rolling of Nala didn't stop until the fat blob lioness was at the very center of the bamboo and wooden structure. Nala had not waken up at all, likely had not noticed outside of her dreaming sleep that she had been moved out of the confines of the small cave of Pride Rock. Asha was gasping and trying to catch her breath from the laborous strain the pushing and rolling had taken on her body.

"Now for the second part of your punishment, Asha." Simba grinned mischivously as another trio of feeding lionesses came up to Asha to give her a midnight snack of a full grown, four ton female hippo. And by the smell of things, there were more recently dead fattened obese and immobile hippos just outside. "You're to be force-fed all day starting tomorrow with guards watching you at all times. They'll take turns of course. Then when you reach Nala's size, you'll be fed the same amount of food she is being fed. And the amount of food you both are being fed will increase ten fold daily. She needs some competition, after all." Simba smiles and pats and caresses on Nala's fat bloated and round milk glands nearest him that had been pushed out from her body fat then also fattened along with her body and she has three on the side Simba is on and three on the other side, giving the fat blob Nala a total of six fat and maybe also milk filled milk glands that look like to be the size of large beanbag chairs, each. Nala's back fat had also swelled upwards in a rolly and bulgy domed shaped mound that was over the height of Nala's fat head by several feet and was just as big as her huge belly was, putting her fat head in the center of her fat front and surrounded by ringing thick neck rolls. Even after the feeder lionesses and Asha had rolled Nala, her blob body had not stopped jiggling and undulating wildy until a whole hour had passed. Her tail tuft had already been engulfed and sunk into her thick tail fat while her four fat paws were almost about to be engulfed, and from the looks of how Nala's gluttonous hunger and feeding was going, it would take tomorrow's feeding to do it. "Enjoy your midnight snack. For your real stuffing begins tomorrow." Simba said as he walked out of the mountain sized encloser and back up to Pride Rock's cave for his sleep.

Nala's lioness feeders moved in to sleep on one side of Nala, Asha was still recovering from the laborous push-rolling, she was shocked by not only the midnight snack she was going to eat but also what was going to happen to her tomorrow and from then on. Laying down slowly on the oppisite side of Nala, Asha's three lioness feeders began tearing off thick and fatty hippo meat and force Asha to eat all the meat she was given until nothing but the hippo's bones were all that were left. Forced to eat all the fatty hippo meat, Asha was left to let the large meal digest while Asha's lioness feeders also went to sleep beside her. The other lioness feeders, both Nala's and Asha's didn't see the baboon shawman come in. Rafiki went over to Nala first and removed a gourd, easily opened Nala's mouth and poured its contents down her throat, then ambled over to her and removed a second gourd and looked at her expectantly.

"You want me to drink that?" Asha said smugly.
"It'll help you, is all. A special potion I made. I gave Nala the same. To help keep you both healthy."
"If it keeps me healthy, sure I'll drink it."

Rafiki held the gourd up for her while Asha tilted her head up so he could pour it down. But she drank it all herself. Hopefully it would help satisfy her stuffed stomach. Then Asha laid her head down to sleep. Rafiki took the gourds with him and chuckled to himself, making his way out of the wooden structure. "They'll both be healthy no matter how big they get, but also they'll gain more than they eat. Way more. Tomorrow morning, Nala will likely weigh as much as ten tons and Asha will likely be at the weight of two hippos." With that, the shawman baboon disappeared into the night and back to his tree.
14112212111111111222222221112221.title: Caught out by Simba and punished!

Asha is actually bigger than Nala and loves her weight gain

Scientists find the lioness blobs and hook each lioness up to giant feeding vats
1411221211111111122222222111222122.content:
Even though Nala had been the fat blob size of a seven ton elephant, with her three large fat and milk bloated milk glands on both sides of her, Nala continued to feast, gorge and glutton on the food provided. Though the fat blob Queen only complained that she wished she was fed faster. However, it didn't stop her body from fattening all the more all over, outwards in all directions and upwards as well, spreading out like flowing liquid lava with the fat blob Queen's fat rippling, jiggling, undulating and wobbling when her body fattened or made the slightest of movements. Nala's tail movement was lost as her tail had become a large fat layered thick blob of rolls with a deep dimple at the end where her tail tuft had sunk in. 14112212111111111222222221112222.content:
It didn't help that Asha's movement was hampered by her new weight, but since it was nightfall, she had all night to use. Carefully, Asha would quietly slink out of the cave that Simba had put her in with the lioness blob that was the fat Nala. Even just outside the entrance to that cave, she could faintly still hear the food Nala had eaten during the day digest in her large stomach, no doubt adding even more fat to her blob of a lioness body. But Asha was disgusted enough that she just had to get out and away from Simba and the fat Queen Nala before she herself ending up Nala's fat blob size. To her it was both ridiculous and disgusting. Asha couldn't figure out how Nala thought and felt the fat made her look more beautiful the fatter she got. She shook her head, if she could get away, she'd work her own fat that she gained off while she had no doubt that Nala would continue to get and gain fatter and fatter. Though, Asha did wonder if and when she might sneak back, she'd find Nala as big and fat as either Pride Rock or even Mount Kilamanjaro. Now that would be a shocking, if incredible, sight to see.

With a soft sigh, and no lioness guards awoken, Asha continued on her slow walk out of the den of the Pride, then out of Pride Rock itself, she walked a bit quicker, down the rocky incline until she reached the base of Pride Rock. From here, she would at least quicken her escape to a easy slow run, not too much to tire her out too fast. She did have a chubby frame on herself now, but that would change. In a slow running pace, she was quicker to hurry her distance from the pride. Though she had to slow to a stop when she got to Scar's old cave to rest for several minutes before continuing on.

Her escape had taken Asha out to near Rafiki's great baobab tree, she rested some ways away from it, as to not awaken the silly old baboon monkey, with renewed hope of escaping completely, Asha had finally gotten on one of the Pridelands borders. Of course, she wasn't planning on completely leaving the lands, cause once she'd slim down to what her regular weight was, she return and check on how Nala was doing, out of curiosity. Eventually, Asha had found a lone outcrop of rock with a well hidden cave that was not in use and made it her own. Now she could work on exercising more and shedding this unneeded weight off. But for tonight, she was tired from her escape and choose to sleep the rest of the night. Tomorrow would be a better day for her, as her training back into shape would start.

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

Despite Asha's leaving, Simba and Nala really didn't care, they didn't need a lioness who had faithfully served under Scar's reign. So with the extra mouth gone, Nala's food amount had doubled again. And she did indeed, take the food willingly, in fact, Nala was fed and ate all day. Of course the lions had to move -or rather roll- Nala outside the cave, to a place just beside Pride Rock on the grassy ground. Nala had commented that she enjoyed it and loved how her fat rolls jiggled and slapped against each other and how her body wobbled like a fat hippo of her own. It only gave her more pleasure of feeling her fat jiggle.

With Nala's increased food consumption, Nala's body bloated steadily through the day, visibly swelling with fat all over. Her neck became a mass of ringing flabby rolls, her legs also became a mass of flabby rolls so much that her fat paws sunk deeply into her leg fat, her tail too became a flabby mass of rolls, rolls of lard built and piled up on her back, as it formed a dome like appearance upon her back fat, she tried to move and bend her fat tail, only to pleasantly discover that it was weighed down with so much flabby rolls of fat that she couldn’t even move to bend it anymore, her neck was so thick with flabby rolls of fat that she couldn’t even turn her head side to side, Nala's head and face cheeks was so bloated and fat that her face was almost lost in the many rolls of flab, her face cheeks bloated out wider and thicker the wider her face cheeks got, her chin rolls was like a river of widening and oozing flabby rolls of fat that spilled down her lower neck rolls and down her fat chest front to spill out and pour outwards in a ever widening pool of oozy and flabby rolls of chins. On either side of her widening chin rolls, Nala's bloating and billowing face cheeks lay out on the ground, bloating her face cheeks out to thicker blobs got cause they too also poured and flowed out of Nala's cave tunnel entrance of her fat neck rolls. It didn't matter that her fat head was sinking back into her mass of ringing neck rolls that piled outwards in front of her fat head, making her head look like it was going back into a deep cavern or tunnel.

The lioness feeders, now four of them, had to climb up Nala's fat front, chin and neck rolls that continued to pour and flow out of the fat neck roll cave tunnel entrance and walk all the way back through the subway train sized cave tunnel of fat neck rolls just to get back to Nala's fat blob of a head, her head was covered in a mass of rolls and it was as big as an sideways hippo itself, even her muzzle was a fat blob of flabby rolls. She never stopped eating throughout the day, only stopped and rested during the night. Only for the gluttonous feeding resumed the next day. Nala had finally reached and surpassed the size of an elephant, a seven ton elephant. Cause Nala was now as fat and big as three elephants combined. Nala's rump, quivering and curving vastly from the ground, around her tail, billowing out to meet her bloated and blubbery flank. Her tail was swollen huge, ten times larger around than a python. Nala's legs, remain showing as side stacked pile of flabby masses of rolls outside her vast belly, each one itself bloated as big around as two hippos. Nala's gluttonous hunger seemed limitless during the day. She was fed and fed. Nala was lost in the endless eating and fattening.

141122121111112.content:
Neither of them wanted to admit it, but a few weeks into Simba's hunting lessons, it was clear to both he and Nala that he was hopelessly inept at catching his own food. It wasn't that he was weak, or slow, or stupid, but he just didn't seem to be able to wrap his mind and muscles around taking down an animal. What was worse was that Nala was slowly getting worse at it, too.

After leading the pride's hunts for so long, Nala was a very competent hunter, and she killed something nearly every day. And thanks to all her efforts, she was starting to gain weight. Nothing huge, only a few pounds here and there, but she was noticeably pudgier, and that meant that she was just a little slower than she had been at her weight. If she kept gaining (and they were still agreed that she should gain), she would eventually become too slow to do any effective hunting, and then they'd be in trouble.

One night, as Nala slept, Simba paced their den considering his options. He was a terrible hunter, and it didn't look like he was going to get any better. Clearly, his only option was to ask for help. But from who?

14112212111112.title: The dream of constant feeding

1411221211112.content:
Simba nodded. "You're right, darling. We'll take it slow; I don't want anything to happen to you." But inwardly, he was impatient: They'd found a way for her to gain quickly, but here Nala was, backing off from her best chance. Well, Simba knew how important gaining was to Nala, and he was determined to help her reach her goals as quickly as possible, even if it meant tricking her.

Breakfast the next day was a small hirola, nowhere near the size of the zebra. As the king, Simba could have gotten a larger portion if he'd wanted to, but he didn't want to arouse Nala's suspicions. He ate a small portion of the meat, and then pushed the rest over to his wife.

"Here, have as much as you want."

Nala's swelling had gone down a lot since the previous day, and Simba was unhappy to see that she hadn't gained a noticeable amount of weight. Ah, well, it was probably too much for him to hope that she'd gain any weight from one night's binge. No matter, he'd change that soon enough.

Nala slowly started eating the antelope, still feeling full from the previous night. She was in no hurry anyway: the remaining meat was enough for a couple good-sized meals.

"You should have heard the way Asha was talking this morning when I went to go get breakfast," he said. Nala looked up from her food, and he clamped a paw over his mouth. "Oh, sorry! How 'bout we, uh, wait until you're done before we start talking about this, okay?"

"No, now I need to know what that witch was saying about me," she replied, ripping a big hunk of meat off the hirola and swallowing it without even bothering to chew.

So Simba made up some lies about Asha (who, he reassured himself, almost certainly would have said these kinds of things if he'd really run into her) calling Nala irresponsible and disgusting, and Nala, outraged, didn't even notice that she'd finished the whole hirola. It was much smaller than the zebra, but it still distended her stomach noticeably, and Simba was content with that.

"Oh, crap," Nala said once she'd realized what had happened. "I did it again. Ugh, you need to warn me when I eat too much."

"Of course, dear," Simba replied, nodding and smiling.
1411221211112.title: Duplicity

choices: "I need to confront Asha."

14112212111121.content:
Though she admonished both Simba and herself whenever she ended up overeating to the point of pain, Nala never once suspected that her mate was doing it on purpose. And not all of the malicious gossip Simba related to her was fabricated: since Nala had stepped down from her hunting duties, the other lionesses, especially Asha, hadn't had anything nice to say about her.

Nala was beginning to fill out after unknowingly binging most every day for a couple weeks. Her stomach was hanging noticeably as though it was always slightly bloated, and she was starting to develop a second chin. It was awfully slow going (and Nala herself didn't seem to notice that she was gaining), but it was sure better than nothing.

Unfortunately, Simba's attempts to get her to stuff herself also put her on edge. She paced their den almost constantly, which wasn't good for gaining, and she was just generally in a poor mood. Eventually, she decided that she'd had enough.

"Simba," she said one day...
14112212111121.title: Oblivious

choices: Lose weight to punish him
Just talk to him
141122121111211.content:
"I need to confront Asha. I'm sick of hiding here and letting her walk around saying whatever she wants about me."

Simba couldn't think of a way to get her to stay without revealing himself. It hadn't all been lies, but his mind raced fruitlessly as he tried to remember what he'd told her that was true, and what he'd told her that wasn't.

"Are you sure?" he hazarded. "I can go talk to her for you if you want..."

"No," Nala said determinedly. "If you fight my battles, she'll only keep making fun of me. I need to do this myself." And without waiting for a response, she strode out of the den.

Asha was in her den, luckily--Nala wasn't about to go chase her down on a hunt, after all.

"What're you doing here, fatass?" she said grumpily.

"I know what you've been saying about me," Nala replied. "And I want you to know that it needs to stop. Immediately. What I do with my personal life is my business, not yours, and you have no right to call me stupid because of my personal life." Man, she was hungry. It was like an automatic response to stress now, but she knew better than to ask Asha for something to eat.

"Woah woah woah," Asha said, holding up her forepaws. "I never called you stupid. Lazy? Sure. A bad queen? Well, maybe. Fat? Um, duh. But I'll thank you to know that I only called you perfectly applicable names, and I have no evidence that you're stupid. Crazy? Ooh, yeah, that's another one. But crazy's not the same as stupid. Who the hell told you that?"

"Simba," Nala said, a little confused. This was not how she had expected this to go. The pale lioness waved a dismissive paw.

"Puh-leeze. Like his highness has any idea what lionesses talk about."

"Why would he tell me that if it wasn't true, hunh?" Nala challenged.

"How should I know? Maybe he's not attracted to you any more since you've become such a hippo."

Nala knew that that wasn't true, at least. If anything, Simba was more excited about the prospect of her gaining than she was. Wait a minute...she thought about how much more she ate when she was upset, and remembered that Simba was always the one to bring up pride gossip while she was eating. The nerve of him!

"Stop talking about me," she said hastily, and then left. As she made her way back to her den, she wondered what to do about Simba.
141122121111211.title: Shifting the Blame

1411221211112112.content:
Nala realized that even though Simba had been duplicitous, his intentions were still basically good. She resolved to call him out on what he was doing as she made her way slowly back to the den.

"Did you give her a good talking-to?" Simba asked as she waddled in the door. Now that Nala knew to look for it, she could tell that he was nervous.

"I know what you've been doing," she replied.

"Hm?" He acted nonchalant, but he wasn't looking her in the eyes.

"You've been making up mean stuff about me to get me to eat more. Well, I want to tell you that it ends now. Understand?"

A thought came to the Queen's mind, she could ask Rafiki if he could or had anything that could help
make her fat and huge. So Nala got up and started walking down from Pride Rock and headed towards
the boabab where the shaman baboon lived.
Once there, Nala called up to him. "Rafiki. Can I speak with you? I've something to ask of you."
Chuckling, the baboon replied. "Wait a bit, old Rafiki needs to get something he just recently made."
What could he made that would make him tell her to wait for him? She'd likely find out.

After some scuffling and rustling in the branches, Rafiki nimbly climbed down and hopped
down in front of her. In both hands he was holding a large object. It was a big fruit, colored like
a passion fruit but bigger in size and roundness.

Nala eyed the fruit-like thing wearily but drove her question home. "If you don't mind, Rafiki,
do you think you can make me a potion that will make he fat and huge? I want the royal
treatment but none of the other lions- including Simba will hunt for me." She said with a pouting
to her muzzle lips.

The baboon chuckled in his crazy way, patting the large fruit he was holding. "What do you
think this thing is, hmm? I was told by a former Queen to make it for you. So, eat this and your
inner desire will begin." He said, holding the large beachball sized passion fruit out to her
with both hands.

With a hunger and greed she never felt before, he took the large fruit in her mouth with a bite,
lowering herself onto the ground and ate the whole thing up. It made her full and temporarily
